title: All ProMedica Sleep Centers Accredited by the American Academy of Sleep Medicine Toledo, Ohio (OH), ProMedica Health System
content:
All ProMedica Sleep Centers Accredited by the American Academy of Sleep Medicine All ProMedica Sleep Centers Accredited by the American Academy of Sleep Medicine
In May, the American Academy of Sleep Medicine (AASM) visited the sleep centers at ProMedica Bay Park, Fostoria and Memorial Hospitals and all hospitals passed the inspection with no provisos. This means that all ProMedica Sleep Centers are now accredited. 



“The AASM is the gold standard for accreditation for sleep,” explained Heather Sheehy, ProMedica Sleep Centers system director. “There are 70 standards in which the program is rated, ranging from the physical structure to physician involvement, policies and record keeping.”



For patients, the accreditation means that ProMedica Sleep Centers have set and achieved policies and procedures that are in line with best practices in sleep medicine.



ProMedica Sleep Centers are located throughout ProMedica’s service area, including Flower, Herrick, Coldwater Regional, Defiance Regional and Monroe Regional Hospitals, in addition to those mentioned above.
The Centers help with common conditions such as sleep apnea, narcolepsy, hypersomnia, periodic limb movement disorder and insomnia. 



Although there are multiple locations, the Centers are one systematic department, says Sheehy. “They have the same policies, procedures, processes and equipment. Our patients can feel confident going to any facility, knowing that if they or someone they know had a study at another location, the experience would be the same.”



Learn more about ProMedica Sleep Centers.

title: ProMedica Home Medical Equipment Moves to Walbridge Toledo, Ohio (OH), ProMedica Health System
content:
ProMedica Home Medical Equipment Moves to WalbridgeProMedica Home Medical Equipment Moves to Walbridge
OREGON, Ohio, March 1, 2018 - ProMedica Home Medical Equipment will move from the campus of ProMedica Bay Park Hospital to a new location in Walbridge on Monday, March 5. The new address will be 30595 Tracy Road.
The Walbridge location will offer the same home medical equipment services as Bay Park Hospital but will provide a larger showroom for the comfort and convenience of patients. Hours will remain the same, Monday – Friday, 8 a.m. – 5 p.m. For more information, call 419-382-1262.
For more information about ProMedica, visit www.promedica.org.
ProMedica is a mission-based, not-for-profit healthcare organization serving northwest Ohio and southern Michigan. The 13-hospital system has more than 17,900 employees, 2,700 physicians and advanced practice providers with privileges, and more than 920 healthcare providers employed by ProMedica Physicians. Additionally, it offers a health plan, Paramount, which serves 344,000 members including more than 243,000 members in the statewide Medicaid plan. Driven by its Mission to improve your health and well-being, ProMedica offers a full range of diagnostic, medical and surgical specialties in areas such as emergency medicine and trauma, behavioral health, heart and vascular, oncology, orthopaedics, neurology, and women’s and children’s services. The health system has been nationally recognized for its advocacy programs and efforts to raise awareness about hunger as a health issue. For more information about ProMedica, please visit www.promedica.org/aboutus.


###

content:

The following ProMedica facilities are closed and events are cancelled due to the weather:

•          ProMedica Laboratories in Michigan – Call ahead

title: ProMedica and Paramount Announce Leadership Changes Toledo, Ohio (OH), ProMedica Health System
content:
ProMedica and Paramount Announce Leadership ChangesProMedica and Paramount Announce Leadership Changes
TOLEDO, Ohio, January 30, 2018 – ProMedica is pleased to announce the following leadership changes, effective March 1.



Jack Randolph, president of Paramount Health Insurance, Inc. has been named Chief Information Technology Officer for ProMedica. 
Randolph has been with ProMedica for 36 years, with 25 of those years at Paramount. Under his leadership, Paramount started the Medicare, Medicaid and Workers' Compensation product lines; acquired numerous companies including Toledo Health Plan, Medical Value Plan, HMS, Advocare, BalaCare, ProComp, and Health Resources Inc.; expanded services into Michigan, West Virginia, Indiana, and other states; and expanded Medicaid and Workers' Comp services statewide in Ohio. All of those accomplishments have helped ProMedica Insurance Corp grow its membership to more than 590,000 and increase its annual revenues to $1.5 billion.
Lori Johnston, ProMedica’s outgoing Chief Information Technology Officer, will transition to President of Paramount Health Care, Inc. 
Johnston has been with ProMedica for 21 years and has held a variety of leadership roles in finance, acute care, post-acute care, ProMedica Physicians Group operations and information technology. She helped grow ProMedica Physicians Group’s provider base and began development of standardized work processes. Most recently, she was instrumental in implementing Epic, a new electronic health record software and improving technical and educational efforts around cybersecurity. 
For more information about ProMedica, visit www.promedica.org.
ProMedica is a mission-based, not-for-profit healthcare organization serving northwest Ohio and southern Michigan.
